from itertools import groupby

def uniq_c(seq):
    ans = []
    for c, e in groupby(seq):
        l = list(e)
        ans.append((c, len(l)))
    return ans

uniq_c=lambda l:(lambda x: [(x[i][1],x[i][0]-x[i-1][0])if i>0 else (x[0][1],x[0][0]+1) for i in range(len(x))])(((lambda t: [(t[i][0],t[i][1]) for i in range(len(t)-1) if t[i][1]!=t[i+1][1]])(list(enumerate(l)))+[(len(l)-1,l[-1])])) if l!=[] else []

def uniq_c(seq): 
    m = []
    n,i = len(seq),0
    while i<n:
        c = seq[i]
        j = i+1
        while j<n and seq[j]==c: j += 1
        m.append((c,j-i))
        i = j
    return m
